item.title: Rainbow Six Siege X Will Feature a 6v6 Mode, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/rainbow-six-siege-x-will-feature-a-6v6-mode-its-claimed/

New details about Rainbow Six Siege X’s beta tests have been leaked, and it seems the game might feature a new 6v6 mode. 

The leaker responsible for accurately predicting the reveal date for Siege X has now provided new details about the upcoming game. According to a new X post (formerly Twitter) by fraxiswinning, Siege X will feature a new 6v6 mode, which the developers seemingly describe as “Experience the new Dual Front game mode featuring 6v6 non-stop action.”  

Besides the 6v6 mode, the leaker provided new information about Siege X’s closed beta test. Per their post, the closed beta test will be hosted between March 13 and 19, beginning on the same day as the Siege X showcase. They aren’t sure how players will get access to it or whether the test will be conducted on consoles, as it will be hosted on a ‘test server’. 

Siege X has been described as “not just another update” but a “major evolution” for the series. The developers are working to ensure the upcoming title remains “at the pinnacle of tactical PvP first-person shooters.” The new instalment will feature graphical and audio upgrades, a refined game feel, and new ways to enjoy it. 

In other news, Rainbow Six Siege will be around for another 10 years after Siege X. Also, the game still tops the esports charts 10 years later. What are your thoughts on Siege X featuring a 6v6 mode? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about The Last of Us limited edition DualSense wireless controller. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Respawn Has Seemingly Canceled Its Unannounced FPS Multiplayer Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/respawn-has-canceled-its-unannounced-fps-multiplayer-game/

An unannounced first-person shooter (FPS) multiplayer game has been canceled at Respawn Entertainment. This news comes via former production coordinator at the studio Emilee Evans.

In a post on LinkedIn on Wednesday, Evans revealed that the “incubation project” she was a part of had been scrapped.

“The unannounced incubation project I was a part of for the past year was canceled this week, so I am joining the group of extremely talented and kind people in the games industry searching for a new role,” Evans said.

The incubation project, while announced, was expected to be a multiplayer FPS title if past job postings were any indication. As far as the theme, setting, or anything else about the game, that remains unknown.

The cancellation of this new game at Respawn follows the cancellation of the studio’s Star Wars Mandalorian game in early 2024. When that was canceled, it was part of restructuring at EA that saw 5% of its staff let go.

What do you think the unannounced multiplayer game being canceled at Respawn? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read our exclusive on Until Dawn remake developer Ballistic Moon being “effectively closed”. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
